Title: HDTV

Title: Worst-Case Scenario

Title: 3x9

Title: Moria

Title: DFS

Title: Analogies

Title: Workaround
Mouseover text: I once worked on a friend's dad's computer. He had the hard drive divided into six partitions, C: through J:, with a 'Documents' directory tree on each one. Each new file appeared to be saved to a partition at random. I knew enough not to ask.

Title: One Two

Title: Dilution

Title: Temper

College Board issues aside, I have fond memories of TI-BASIC, writing in it a 3D graphing engine and a stock market analyzer. With enough patience, I could make anything ... but friends. (Although with my chatterbot experiments, I certainly tried.)

Title: War

Title: University Website

Title: Wisdom Teeth
Mouseover text: I heard the general anesthesia drugs can cause amnesia, so when I woke up mid-extraction I started taking notes on my hand so I'd remember things later. I managed 'AWAKE BUT EVERYTHING OK' before the dental assistant managed to find and confiscate all my pens.

Title: Let Go
Mouseover text: After years of trying various methods, I broke this habit by pitting my impatience against my laziness. I decoupled the action and the neurological reward by setting up a simple 30-second delay I had to wait through, in which I couldn't do anything else, before any new page or chat client would load (and only allowed one to run at once). The urge to check all those sites magically vanished--and my 'productive' computer use was unaffected.

Title: Major in the Universe
Mouseover text: I hear Steven Levitt is writing a book analyzing A.J. Jacobs' quest to spend a year reading everything Malcolm Gladwell ever wrote. The audiobook will be narrated by Robert Krulwich of Radiolab.

Title: Flying Cars
Mouseover text: It's hard to fit in the backseat of my flying car with my android Realdoll when we're both wearing jetpacks.

Title: Nanobots
Mouseover text: I think the IETF hit the right balance with the 128 bits thing. We can fit MAC addresses in a /64 subnet, and the nanobots will only be able to devour half the planet.

Title: Compass and Straightedge

Title: Herpetology
Mouseover text: Birds are Aves, which is part of the clade Theropoda, which is in Saurischia, which is in Dinosauria. Those birds outside our windows are dinosaurs. We can clear out the rest of our brains because we now have the best fact.

Title: Nolan Chart
Mouseover text: Also in the right quadrant are NFPA-compliant chemical manufacturers and Sir Charles Wheatstone. Sharing the top with the internet libertarians are Nate Silver and several politically-active kite designers.

Title: Server Attention Span

Title: Advertising

Title: Charity

Title: Heaven

Title: Etymology

Title: Movie Ages

Title: Null Hypothesis

Title: 65 Years

Title: Progeny
Mouseover text: I tell my children 'it's not whether you win or lose, it's how you play the game.' I'm trying to take the edge off their competitive drive to ensure that I can always beat them.

Title: Teaching Physics

Mouseover text: Even governmental elevator inspectors get bored halfway through asking where the building office is.

Title: Chain of Command
Mouseover text: Themistocles said his infant son ruled all Greece -- "Athens rules all Greece; I control Athens; my wife controls me; and my infant son controls her." Thus, nowadays the world is controlled by whoever buys advertising time on Dora the Explorer.

Title: Mimic Octopus

Title: Tattoo
Mouseover text: I calculate that the electrons in radiation therapy hit you at 99.8% of the speed of light, and the beam used in a 90-second gamma ray therapy session could, if fired with less precision, kill a horse (they did not let me test this).

Mouseover text: It's fun to watch browsers fumblingly recapitulate the history of window management. Someday we'll have xmonad as a Firefox extension.

Mouseover text: I've looked at clouds from both sides now.

Title: Hurricane Names
Mouseover text: After exhausting the OED, we started numbering them. When overlapping hurricanes formed at all points on the Earth's surface, and our scheme was foiled by Cantor diagonalization, we just decided to name them all "Steve". Your local forecast tomorrow is "Steve". Good luck.

Title: I'm Sorry
Mouseover text: You know I've always hated her.

Title: Family Decals
Mouseover text: My decal set has no adults, just a sea of hundreds of the little girl figures closing in around a single cat.

Title: Investing
Mouseover text: But Einstein said it was the most powerful force in the universe, and I take all my investment advice from flippant remarks by theoretical physicists making small talk at parties.

Title: AI
Mouseover text: And they both react poorly to showers.

Title: File Transfer

Title: Mystery Solved

Title: Working
Mouseover text: And if you drive a typical car more than a mile out of your way for each penny you save on the per-gallon price, it doesn't matter how worthless your time is to you--the gas to get you there and back costs more than you save.

Title: Stud Finder
Mouseover text: According to every stud finder I've tried to use, my walls contain a rapidly shifting network of hundreds and hundreds of studs.

Title: Neutrinos

Title: Sharing

Title: Development

Title: Hotels

Title: Subliminal
Mouseover text: Once you see it, you can't help seeing it every time. Until your body finishes metabolizing the mushrooms.

Title: Eternal Flame
Mouseover text: There's always the hope that if you sit and watch for long enough, the beachball will vanish and the thing it interrupted will return.

Title: The Corliss Resolution

Title: X11
Mouseover text: Thomas Jefferson thought that every law and every constitution should be torn down and rewritten from scratch every nineteen years--which means X is overdue.

Title: Dorm Poster

Title: Elements
Mouseover text: Of all the nations, the armies of the ununoctium-benders are probably the least intimidating. The xenon-benders come close, but their flickery signs are at least effective for propaganda.

Title: Jet Fuel

Title: Prairie
Mouseover text: Colorado is working to develop coherent amber waves, which would allow them to finally destroy Kansas and Nebraska with a devastating but majestic grain laser.

Title: Everything
Mouseover text: I wanna hold your hand so I don't fall out of your gyrocopter.

Title: Delta-P
Mouseover text: If you fire a Portal gun through the door of the wardrobe, space and time knot together, which leads to a frustrated Aslan trying to impart Christian morality to the Space sphere.

Title: The Important Field
Mouseover text: I hear in some places, you need one form of ID to buy a gun, but two to pay for it by check. It's interesting who has what incentives to care about what mistakes.

Title: Alternative Literature
Mouseover text: I just noticed CVS has started stocking homeopathic pills on the same shelves with--and labeled similarly to--their actual medicine. Telling someone who trusts you that you're giving them medicine, when you know you’re not, because you want their money, isn’t just lying--it’s like an example you’d make up if you had to illustrate for a child why lying is wrong.

Title: November
Mouseover text: November marks the birthday of Charles Schulz, pioneer of tongue awareness.

Title: MTV Generation
Mouseover text: If you identified with the kids from The Breakfast Club when it came out, you're now much closer to the age of Principal Vernon.

Title: The General Problem
Mouseover text: I find that when someone's taking time to do something right in the present, they're a perfectionist with no ability to prioritize, whereas when someone took time to do something right in the past, they're a master artisan of great foresight.

Title: Occulting Telescope
Mouseover text: Type II Kardashev civilizations eventually completely enclose their planetary system in a Dyson sphere because space is way too big to look at all the time.

Title: Sail

Title: Map Projections
Mouseover text: What's that? You think I don't like the Peters map because I'm uncomfortable with having my cultural assumptions challenged?  Are you sure you're not ... ::puts on sunglasses:: ... projecting?

Title: Citogenesis
Mouseover text: I just read a pop-science book by a respected author. One chapter, and much of the thesis, was based around wildly inaccurate data which traced back to ... Wikipedia. To encourage people to be on their toes, I'm not going to say what book or author.

Title: Set Theory
Mouseover text: Proof of Zermelo's well-ordering theorem given the Axiom of Choice: 1: Take S to be any set. 2: When I reach step three, if S hasn't managed to find a well-ordering relation for itself, I'll feed it into this wood chipper. 3: Hey, look, S is well-ordered.

Title: Privacy

Title: Space Launch System

Title: Percentage Points
Mouseover text: Grayton also proposed making college scholarships available exclusively to sexually active teens, amnesty for illegal immigrants who create room for themselves by killing a citizen, and a graduated income tax based on penis size. He has been endorsed by Tracy Morgan, John Wilkes Booth's ghost, and the Time Cube guy.

Title: Drinking Fountains
Mouseover text: I've always wondered whether you could drink slowly enough, and eliminate fast enough, that you just sort of peed continuously. But I'm afraid to try because I worry someone might call while I'm doing it and ask what I'm up to, and I won't be able to think of a lie.

Title: Potential

Title: Tradition
Mouseover text: An 'American tradition' is anything that happened to a baby boomer twice.

Title: Cryogenics
Mouseover text: 'Welcome to the future! Nothing's changed.' was the slogan of my astonishingly short-lived tech startup.

Title: Plastic Bags
Mouseover text: The high I feel when I actually remember to bring my reusable bags to the store--and take them inside rather than leaving them in the parked car--can last for days.

Title: Phantom Menace
Mouseover text: We could go to the theater across town and see if it's opened THERE yet, but we don't want to lose our place in line.

Title: Mnemonics

Title: Brand Identity

Title: Advent Calendar
Mouseover text: I think you could get up to about 11:59:57 before you'd have trouble swallowing the chocolates fast enough. At that point, you'd need some kind of a liquify-and-chug apparatus to get up over the 11:59:59 barrier. Anyway, Merry Christmas!

Title: Coinstar

Title: Making Things Difficult

Title: Wait Wait
Mouseover text: You can't stab Carl Kasell. He sounds all slow and stentorian, but he moves like a snake.
To compensate for this, I plan to spend 2013 doing nothing but talking about Mayans. My relationships with my friends and family may not fare well.

Title: Cougars
Mouseover text: If you're lying in bed tonight and you see yellow eyes glinting in your window, are you being stalked by a puma, a mountain lion, a panther, a catamount, or a cougar? Trick question--in North America, they're all names for the same species, Puma concolor! Isn't learning fun? Anyway, sleep tight!

Title: Umwelt

Mouseover text: Implausible, did you say? Sorry, couldn't quite hear you from all the way up heeeeeeeeere!

Mouseover text: I'll never forget you--at least, the parts of you that were important red flags.

Title: Forgot Algebra
Mouseover text: The only things you HAVE to know are how to make enough of a living to stay alive and how to get your taxes done. All the fun parts of life are optional.

Title: Every Major's Terrible
Mouseover text: Someday I'll be the first to get a Ph. D in 'Undeclared'.

Title: Felidae

Title: Klout
Mouseover text: Though please do confirm that it's actually *me* on Klout first, and not one of my friends trying to get me punched. The great thing about this douchebag deadman switch is that I will never dare trigger it.

Title: Old-Timers
Mouseover text: You were on the internet before I was born? Well, so was I.

Title: Bel-Air

Title: Crowdsourcing
Mouseover text: We don't sell products; we sell the marketplace. And by 'sell the marketplace' we mean 'play shooters, sometimes for upwards of 20 hours straight.'

Title: EST

Title: Budget News
Mouseover text: I will vote, no questions asked, for any candidate who describes themselves as 'more of a deficit sugar glider.'

Title: Kill Hitler
Mouseover text: Revised directive: It is forbidden for you to interfere with human history until you've at least taken a class on it.

Title: Front Door
Mouseover text: FYI: I'll be releasing a wolf into a randomly-chosen front yard sometime in the next 30 years. Now your fear is reasonable, and you don't need to feel embarrassed anymore. Problem solved!

Title: Shoes

Title: Laundry
Mouseover text: During the second semester, the path is briefly routed through the dishwasher.

Title: Pressures

Title: Swiftkey
Mouseover text: Although the Markov chain-style text model is still rudimentary; it recently gave me "Massachusetts Institute of America". Although I have to admit it sounds prestigious.

Title: Alphabet
Mouseover text: Do I get to remove letters entirely? Or just rearrange them? Because the 'k/c' situation is ridiculous. Look, we can make out whenever. This is *immortality*!

Title: Words for Small Sets
Mouseover text: If things are too quiet, try asking a couple of friends whether "a couple" should always mean "two". As with the question of how many spaces should go after a period, it can turn acrimonious surprisingly fast unless all three of them agree.

Title: Exoplanets

Title: Pale Blue Dot
Mouseover text: Our planet is a lonely speck in the great enveloping cosmic dark. In our obscurity, in all this vastness, there is no hint that help will come from elsewhere to save us from ourselves. There is no road out of this oblivion; we must embrace it. We must join with the darkness. Ba'al the Annihilator offers us no happiness, no answers, naught but the cold embrace of the void. To imagine any other end is delusion. We must give in to the will of Ba'al, for he will one day consume us and our world alike. I therefore call on Congress to fully fund space exploration, and to join with Ba'al, the Eater of Souls. Thank you.

Title: Goldbach Conjectures
Mouseover text: The weak twin primes conjecture states that there are infinitely many pairs of primes. The strong twin primes conjecture states that every prime p has a twin prime (p+2), although (p+2) may not look prime at first. The tautological prime conjecture states that the tautological prime conjecture is true.

Some future reader, who may see the term, without knowing the history of it, may imagine that it had reference to some antiquated bridge of the immortal Poet, thrown across the silver Avon, to facilitate his escape after some marauding excursion in a neighbouring park; and in some Gentleman's Magazine of the next century, it is not impossible, but that future antiquaries may occupy page after page in discussing so interesting a matter. We think it right, therefore, to put it on record in the Oriental Herald that the 'Shakesperian Rope Bridges' are of much less classic origin; that Mr Colin Shakespear, who, besides his dignity as Postmaster, now signs himself 'Superintendent General of Shakesperian Rope Bridges', is a person of much less genius than the Bard of Avon. --The Oriental Herald, 1825

Title: xkcd Phone

Price includes 2-year Knicks contract. Phone may extinguish nearby birthday candles. If phone ships with Siri, return immediately; do not speak to her and ignore any instructions she gives. Do not remove lead casing. Phone may attract/trap insects; this is normal. Volume adjustable (requires root). If you experience sudden tingling, nausea, or vomiting, perform a factory reset immediately. Do not submerge in water; phone will drown. Exterior may be frictionless. Prolonged use can cause mood swings, short-term memory loss, and seizures. Avert eyes while replacing battery. Under certain circumstances, wireless transmitter may control God.

Title: Writing Skills

I've heard the idea that exposure to all this amateur peer practice is hurting us, but I'd bet on the generation that conducts the bulk of their social lives via the written word over the generation that occasionally wrote book reports and letters to grandma once a year, any day.

Mouseover text: I pronounce epitome "EPPY-tome", but EpiPen "uh-PIE-pen".

Title: Incognito Mode
Mouseover text: They're really the worst tech support team. And their solutions are always the same. "This OS X update broke something." "LET'S INFILTRATE APPLE BY MORPHING APPLES!"

Title: Rayleigh Scattering
Mouseover text: If you ask "why are leaves green?" the usual answer is "because they're full of chlorophyll, and chlorophyll is green," even though "why does chlorophyll scatter green light?" is a great question too.

Title: Sweet 16
Mouseover text: Every year I make out my bracket at the season, and every year it's busted before the first game when I find out which teams are playing.

Title: Security Advice
Mouseover text: Never give your password or bank account number to anyone who doesn't have a blue check mark next to their name.

Title: Incinerator
Mouseover text: My trash can broke recently and I had to get rid of it. When I picked it up, I suffered a brief but harrowing existential crisis.

Title: Existential Bug Reports
Mouseover text: ISSUE: If we wait long enough, the Earth will eventually be consumed by the Sun. WORKAROUND: None.

Title: Hottest Editors
Mouseover text: Elon Musk finally blocked me from the internal Tesla repository because I wouldn't stop sending pull requests for my code supporting steering via vim keybindings.

Title: Identification Chart
Mouseover text: Be careful—it's breeding season, and some of these can be *extremely* defensive of their nests.

Title: 7 Eleven
Mouseover text: Really, the only honest 24-hour stores are the ones in places like Arizona and Hawaii, and many of them are still wrong in certain years.

Title: Birdwatching
Mouseover text: No, tell the park rangers to calm down, it's fine--I put a screen on the front. I just want to get the birds a little closer.

Title: Survivorship Bias
Mouseover text: They say you can't argue with results, but what kind of defeatist attitude is that? If you stick with it, you can argue with ANYTHING.

Title: ISS Solar Transit

Mouseover text: Most people don't realize it, but they actually launch a new space station every few weeks because this keeps happening.

Title: Here to Help
Mouseover text: "We TOLD you it was hard." "Yeah, but now that I'VE tried, we KNOW it's hard."

Title: Photo Library Management
Mouseover text: A good lifehack is to use messy and unstable systems to organize your photos. That way, every five years or so it becomes obsolete and/or collapses, and you have to open it up and pick only your favorite pictures to salvage.

Title: Code Quality 3
Mouseover text: It's like a half-solved cryptogram where the solution is a piece of FORTH code written by someone who doesn't know FORTH.

Title: Lunch Order
Mouseover text: GO FOR LUNCH, REPEAT, GO FOR LUNCH.

Title: Random Obsessions
Mouseover text: I take the view that "open-faced sandwiches" are not sandwiches, but all other physical objects are.

Mouseover text: WHEN I WAS ON A BOAT I DROPPED MY PHONE CAN U LOOK FOR IT

Title: Rental Car
Mouseover text: Technically, both cars are haunted, but the murder ghosts can't stand listening to the broken GPS for more than a few minutes.

Title: Machine Learning
Mouseover text: The pile gets soaked with data and starts to get mushy over time, so it's technically recurrent.

Title: Doctor Visit
Mouseover text: According to these blood tests, you're like 30% cereal.

Mouseover text: That's very exciting! The bad news is that it's a risk factor for a lot of things.

Title: Who?
Mouseover text: Gonna feel even dumber when I realize that all this time he's been talking into a bluetooth thingy and we're not actually friends.

Title: Anti-Drone Eagles
Mouseover text: It's cool, it's totally ethical--they're all programmed to hunt whichever bird of prey is most numerous at the moment, so they leave the endangered ones alone until near the end.

Title: Opening Crawl
Mouseover text: Using a classic Timothy Zahn EU/Legends novel is bad enough, but at least the style and setting aren't too far off. If you really want to mess with people, try using Splinter of the Mind's Eye.

Title: Voting Systems
Mouseover text: Kenneth Arrow hated me because the ordering of my preferences changes based on which voting systems have what level of support. But it tells me a lot about the people I'm going to be voting with!

Title: State Word Map
Mouseover text: The top search for every state is PORN, except Florida, where it's SEX PORN.

Title: Drone Problems
Mouseover text: On the other hand, as far as they know, my system is working perfectly.

Title: Dubious Study
Mouseover text: Sounds fine. I looked up the Academy, and it says on their MySpace page that their journal is peer-viewed and downloaded biannually.

Title: Glacial Erratic
Mouseover text: "This will take a while, which sucks, because I'm already so busy chiseling out igneous intrusions from rock formations and watching Youtube loops of the Superman fault-sealing scene over and over."

Title: Decades
Mouseover text: In the 90s, our variety radio station used the tagline "the best music of the 70s, 80s, and 90s." After 2000, they switched to "the best music of the 80s, 90s, and today." I figured they'd change again in 2010, but it's 2017 and they're still saying "80s, 90s, and today." I hope radio survives long enough for us to find out how they deal with the 2020s.

Title: Air Force Museum
Mouseover text: I had fun visiting the museum at Dover Air Force Base, unless they don't have a museum, in which case I've never been to Delaware in my life.

Title: Magnetohydrodynamics
Mouseover text: Magnetohydrodynamics combines the intuitive nature of Maxwell's equations with the easy solvability of the Navier-Stokes equations. It's so straightforward physicists add "relativistic" or "quantum" just to keep it from getting boring.

Title: Election Map
Mouseover text: Luckily for my interpretation, no precincts were won by the Green Party.

Title: Once Per Day
Mouseover text: I'm not totally locked into my routine—twice a year, I take a break to change the batteries in my smoke detectors.

Title: Refresh Types
Mouseover text: The hardest refresh requires both a Mac keyboard and a Windows keyboard as a security measure, like how missile launch systems require two keys to be turned at once.

Title: Telephoto
Mouseover text: I was banned from the airliners.net photography forum by concerned moderators after the end of my lens started brushing against planes as they flew by.

Title: Existence Proof
Mouseover text: Real analysis is way realer than I expected.

Title: Emoji Movie
Mouseover text: Some other studio should do the Antz/A Bug's Life thing and release The Dingbats Movie at the same time.

Title: 4th of July
Mouseover text: Strangely, they still celebrate by eating hot dogs. Since they don't have mouths, they just kinda toss them in the air and let them fall back down into their propeller blades. It's pretty messy.

Title: Sports Knowledge
Mouseover text: I heard they might make the wild card game, which would be cool. Do you know when that is? I have a wedding next weekend, but if it's after that we could try to go!

Title: Communicating
Mouseover text: You're saying that the responsibility for avoiding miscommunication lies entirely with the listener, not the speaker, which explains why you haven't been able to convince anyone to help you down from that wall.

Title: Quantum
Mouseover text: If you draw a diagonal line from lower left to upper right, that's the ICP 'Miracles' axis.

Title: Particle Properties
Mouseover text: Each particle also has a password which allows its properties to be changed, but the cosmic censorship hypothesis suggests we can never observe the password itself—only its secure hash.

Title: Screenshots
Mouseover text: For the final exam, you take a screenshot showing off all the work you've done in the class, and it has to survive being uploaded, thumbnailed, and re-screenshotted through a chain of social media sites.

Title: City Nicknames
Mouseover text: This place has so many demonyms. Northlanders. Fair Folk. Honey Barons. Lake Dwellers. Treasurers. Swamp Watchers. Dream Farmers. Wellfolk. Rockeaters. Forgotten Royals. Remote Clients. Barrow-Clerks. The People of Land and Sky.

Title: Wifi vs Cellular
Mouseover text: According to the cable company reps who keep calling me, it's because I haven't upgraded to the XTREME GIGABAND PANAMAX FLAVOR-BLASTED PRO PACKAGE WITH HBO, which is only $5 more per month for the first 6 months and five billion dollars per month after that.

Title: Russell's Teapot
Mouseover text: Unfortunately, NASA regulations state that Bertrand Russell-related payloads can only be launched within launch vehicles which do not launch themselves.

Title: Physics Confession
Mouseover text: "You know lightning, right? When electric charge builds up in a cloud and then discharges in a giant spark? Ask me why that happens." "Why does tha--" "No clue. We think it's related to the hair thing."

Title: Eclipse Flights
Mouseover text: The captain has turned on the 'fasten seat belt' sign.

Title: Positive and Negative Reviews
Mouseover text: This restaurant is great! I was feeling really sick, but then I ate there and felt better!

Title: Emoji Movie Reviews
Mouseover text: There's this idea that emoji are bad for communication because they replace ambiguity and nuance with a limited set of preselected emotions, but it doesn't really survive a collision with real-world usage of the thinking face or upside-down smiley.

Title: Bun Alert
Mouseover text: Since buns range from crepuscular to nocturnal, it's recommended that you enable the scheduled "Do Not Disturb" mode on your phone to avoid being woken by alerts about Night Buns.

Title: Backup Batteries
Mouseover text: If it falls below 20% full, my bag turns red and I start to panic.

Title: Email Reply
Mouseover text: I would be honored, but I know I don't belong in your network. The person you invited was someone who had not yet inflicted this two-year ordeal upon you. I'm no longer that person.

Title: Geologic Faults
Mouseover text: I live on a torn-bag-of-potato-chips-where-the-tear-is-rapidly-growing fault, which is terrifying.

Title: Computers vs Humans
Mouseover text: It's hard to train deep learning algorithms when most of the positive feedback they get is sarcastic.

Title: Eclipse Searches
Mouseover text: There were traffic jams for the eclipses in 1970 and 1979, and that was *before* we had the potential for overnight viral social media frenzies.

Title: Eclipse Science
Mouseover text: I was thinking of observing stars to verify Einstein's theory of relativity again, but I gotta say, that thing is looking pretty solid at this point.

Title: Earth Orbital Diagram
Mouseover text: You shouldn't look directly at a partial eclipse because of the damage that can be caused by improperly aligning the solar-lunar orbital plane with the orbital bones around your eye.

Title: Eclipse Birds
Mouseover text: 'Hey! Put her down!' 'No, it's ok! The next chance for me to be carried to a blood cauldron isn't until 2024!'

Title: Eclipse Review
Mouseover text: I watched from a beautiful nature reserve in central Missouri, and it was--without exaggeration--the coolest thing I've ever seen.

Title: Drone Training
Mouseover text: The joke will be on him in a few weeks when animal control shows up and takes custody of his Roomba.

Title: Color Models
Mouseover text: What if what *I* see as blue, *you* see as a slightly different blue because you're using Chrome instead of Firefox and despite a decade of messing with profiles we STILL can't get this right somehow.

Title: Supervillain Plan
Mouseover text: Someday, some big historical event will happen during the DST changeover, and all the tick-tock articles chronicling how it unfolded will have to include a really annoying explanation next to their timelines.

Title: Ringer Volume/Media Volume
Mouseover text: Our new video ad campaign has our product's name shouted in the first 500 milliseconds, so we can reach the people in adjacent rooms while the viewer is still turning down the volume.

Title: Ensemble Model
Mouseover text: I'm in talks with Netflix to produce an alternate-universe crime drama about the world where sliced bread was never re-legalized, but it's going slowly because they keep changing their phone numbers and the door lock codes at their headquarters.

Title: Typing Notifications
Mouseover text: Over the years I've decided I'd rather have them on than not, but I'm glad there aren't "has opened a blank note to compose a reply to you" notifications.

Title: Two Down, One to Go
Mouseover text: The third row will probably have to wait until 2034, and maybe longer. If I see a daytime supernova, I'll replace the meteor storm with that and consider it 3/3.

Title: Still in Use
Mouseover text: 'Which one?' 'I dunno, it's your house. Just check each object.' 'Check it for *what*?' 'Whether it looks like it might have touched a paper towel at some point and then forgotten to let go.' '...' 'You can also Google to learn how to check which things are using which resources.' 'You know, I'll just leave the towel there and try again tomorrow.'

Title: xkcd Phone 6
Mouseover text: We understand your privacy concerns; be assured that our phones will never store or transmit images of your face.

Title: What to Bring
Mouseover text: I always figured you should never bring a gun to a gun fight because then you'll be part of a gun fight.

Title: Obsolete Technology
Mouseover text: And I can't believe some places still use fax machines. The electrical signals waste so much time going AROUND the Earth when neutrino beams can go straight through!

Title: USB Cables
Mouseover text: Tag yourself, I'm "frayed."

Title: Thread
Mouseover text: Since the current Twitter threadfall kicked off in early 2016, we can expect it to continue until the mid 2060s when the next Interval begins.

Title: Real Estate
Mouseover text: I tried converting the prices into pizzas, to put it in more familiar terms, and it just became a hard-to-think-about number of pizzas.

Title: Worrying Scientist Interviews
Mouseover text: They always try to explain that they're called 'solar physicists', but the reporters interrupt with "NEVER MIND THAT, TELL US WHAT'S WRONG WITH THE SUN!"

Title: Active Ingredients Only
Mouseover text: Contains the active ingredients from all competing cold medicines, plus the medicines for headaches, arthritis, insomnia, indigestion, and more, because who wants THOSE things?

Title: Self Driving
Mouseover text: "Crowdsourced steering" doesn't sound quite as appealing as "self driving."

Title: October 2017
Mouseover text: And yet I have no trouble believing that the start of the 2016 election was several decades ago.

Title: Ears
Mouseover text: My theory is that most humans have been colonized with alien mind-control slugs that hold the earbuds for them, and the ones who can't wear earbuds are the only surviving free ones.

Title: Jet Lag
Mouseover text: I had some important research to do on proposed interstellar space missions, basketball statistics, canceled skyscrapers, and every article linked from "Women in warfare and the military in the 19th century."

Title: Logical
Mouseover text: It's like I've always said--people just need more common sense. But not the kind of common sense that lets them figure out that they're being condescended to by someone who thinks they're stupid, because then I'll be in trouble.

Title: State Borders
Mouseover text: A schism between the pro-panhandle and anti-panhandle factions eventually led to war, but both sides spent too much time working on their flag designs to actually do much fighting.

Title: Bun Trend
Mouseover text: Our experts have characterized the ecological impact of this trend as "adorable."

Title: Research Risks
Mouseover text: The 1919 Great Boston Molasses Flood remained the deadliest confectionery containment accident until the Canadian Space Agency's 2031 orbital maple syrup delivery disaster.

Title: Cast Iron Pan
Mouseover text: If you want to evenly space them, it's easiest to alternate between the Arctic and Antarctic. Some people just go to the Arctic twice, near the equinoxes so the visits are almost 6 months apart, but it's not the same.

Title: Making Progress
Mouseover text: I started off with countless problems. But now I know, thanks to COUNT(), that I have "#REF! ERROR: Circular dependency detected" problems.

Title: Immune System
Mouseover text: It also helps with negotiation. "Look, if it were up to me, *I'd* accept your offer, but my swarm of autonomous killer cells literally can't be reasoned with. It's out of my hands!"

Title: Credit Card Rewards
Mouseover text: I should make a list of all the things I could be trying to optimize, prioritized by ... well, I guess there are a few different variables I could use. I'll create a spreadsheet ...

Title: Digital Resource Lifespan
Mouseover text: I spent a long time thinking about how to design a system for long-term organization and storage of subject-specific informational resources without needing ongoing work from the experts who created them, only to realized I'd just reinvented libraries.

Title: Sky Spotters
Mouseover text: Where I live, one of the most common categories of sky object without a weird obsessive spotting community is "lost birthday party balloons," so that might be a good choice—although you risk angering the marine wildlife people, and they have sharks.

Title: Defensive Profile
Mouseover text: NO DRAMA ZONE -> If I've made you sad, you'd better not tell me, because I am TERRIFIED of that situation and have NO IDEA how to handle it.

Title: Thermostat
Mouseover text: Your problem is so terrible, I worry that, if I help you, I risk drawing the attention of whatever god of technology inflicted it on you.

Title: A �
Mouseover text: If you want in on the fun, map a key on your keyboard to the sequence U+0041 U+0020 U+FFFD (or U+0021 U+0020 U+FFFD for the exclamation point version), and then no update can never take this away from you.

Title: Twitter Verification
Mouseover text: When we started distributing special status tokens that signify which people are important enough to join an elite group, we never could have imagined we might be creating some problems down the line.

Title: Nightmare Email Feature
Mouseover text: "...just got back and didn't see your message until just now. Sorry! -- TIME THIS MESSAGE SAT HALF-FINISHED IN DRAFTS FOLDER: 3 days, 2 hours, 45 minutes."

Title: Temperature Preferences
Mouseover text: There's a supposed Mark Twain quote, "The coldest winter I ever spent was a summer in San Francisco." It isn't really by Mark Twain, but I don't know who said it—I just know they've never been to McMurdo Station.

Title: How to Make Friends
Mouseover text: No, wait, come back! I want to be friends at you!

Title: NEXUS
Mouseover text: You also refuse to buy Cisco products because you hate the Thong Song, O. Henry, Deep Space Nine, freshwater whitefish, teenaged Incan emperors, Brak's brother, and vegetable-based shortening.

Title: Interstellar Asteroid
Mouseover text: Every time we detect an asteroid from outside the Solar System, we should immediately launch a mission to fling one of our asteroids back in the direction it came from.

Title: Emoji Sports
Mouseover text: No horse has yet managed the elusive Quadruple Crown—winning the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness, the Belmont Stakes, and the Missouri Horse Hole.

Title: The Moon and the Great Wall
Mouseover text: And arguably sunspots, on rare occasions. But even if they count, it takes ideal conditions and you might hurt your eyes.

Title: Interferometry
Mouseover text: It's important to note that while the effective size of the dog can be arbitrarily large, it's not any more of a good dog than the two original dogs.

Title: Felsius
Mouseover text: The symbol for degrees Felsius is an average of the Euro symbol (€) and the Greek lunate epsilon (ϵ).

Title: Solar Panels
Mouseover text: This works for a surprising range of sunlit things, including rooftops (sure), highway surfaces (probably not), sailboats (maybe), and jets, cars, and wild deer (haha good luck).

Title: Self-Driving Car Milestones
Mouseover text: I'm working on a car capable of evaluating arbitrarily complex boolean expressions on "honk if [...]" bumper stickers and responding accordingly.

Title: Bad Code
Mouseover text: "Oh my God, why did you scotch-tape a bunch of hammers together?" "It's ok! Nothing depends on this wall being destroyed efficiently."

Title: Tinder
Mouseover text: People keep telling me to use the radio but I really hate making voice calls.

Title: Seven Years
Mouseover text: [hair in face] "SEVVVENNN YEEEARRRSSS"

Title: Argument Timing
Mouseover text: Of course, everyone has their own profile. There are morning arguers, hangry arguers, meal-time arguers, late-night arguers, and people who get in a meta-argument over what their argument timing is, dredge up examples of past arguments, and end up fighting over THOSE again as well.

Title: Calendar Facts
Mouseover text: While it may seem like trivia, it (causes huge headaches for software developers / is taken advantage of by high-speed traders / triggered the 2003 Northeast Blackout / has to be corrected for by GPS satellites / is now recognized as a major cause of World War I).

Title: Virtual Assistant
Mouseover text: If you ask it to please turn off that feature, it apologizes a whole bunch and promises to try to be quieter, then switches to a slightly lower-volume version of the clip with "sorry!" after the louder sounds.

Title: The True Meaning of Christmas
Mouseover text: They all made fun of Autometalogolex, but someday there will be a problem with Christmas that can only be solved if Santa somehow gets a serious headache, and then they'll see.

Title: Santa Facts
Mouseover text: We've gotten him up to 20% milk and cookies through an aggressive public campaign, but that seems to be his dietary limit. Anything above that and he starts developing nutritional deficiencies.

Title: Phone Security
Mouseover text: ...wait until they type in payment information, then use it to order yourself a replacement phone.
We should really start calculating it earlier, but until the end of December we're always too busy trying to figure out which day Christmas will fall on.

Title: Desert Golfing
Mouseover text: I just want to stay up long enough to watch the ball drop into the hole number 2018.

Title: IATA Airport Abbreviations
Mouseover text: IATA stands for International AirporT Abbreviation.

Title: Meltdown and Spectre
Mouseover text: New zero-day vulnerability: In addition to rowhammer, it turns out lots of servers are vulnerable to regular hammers, too.

Title: 2016 Election Map
Mouseover text: I like the idea of cartograms (distorted population maps), but I feel like in practice they often end up being the worst of both worlds—not great for showing geography OR counting people. And on top of that, they have all the problems of a chloro... chorophl... chloropet... map with areas colored in.

Title: The Food Size Cycle
Mouseover text: There's data suggesting that this model may apply to deep-dish/thin-crust pizza. I've designed a thorough multi-year study to investigate this personally, but funding organizations keep denying my grant requests.

Title: Dying Gift
Mouseover text: And to you, I leave my life-sized ice sculpture replica of the Pietà which was blessed by the Pope. You must never let it melt! Now, remember, all gifts must be removed from my estate within 24 hours.

Mouseover text: "Since there's no ending quote mark, everything after this is part of my quote. —Randall Munroe

Title: The End of the Rainbow
Mouseover text: The retina is the exposed surface of the brain, so if you think about a pot of gold while looking at a rainbow, then there's one at BOTH ends.

Title: Scientific Paper Graph Quality
Mouseover text: The worst are graphs with qualitative, vaguely-labeled axes and very little actual data.

Title: Hawaii
Mouseover text: Ok, I've got it, just need to plug in my security key. Hmm, which way does the USB go? Nope, not that way. I'll just flip it and– OH JEEZ IT FELL INTO THE VENT.

Title: Night Sky
Mouseover text: There's a mountain lion nearby, but it didn't notice you because it's reading Facebook.

Title: Campaign Fundraising Emails
Mouseover text: The establishment doesn't take us seriously. You know who else they didn't take seriously? Hitler. I'll be like him, but a GOOD guy instead of...

Title: Fruit Collider
Mouseover text: The most delicious exotic fruit discovered this way is the strawberry banana. Sadly, it's only stable in puree form, so it's currently limited to yogurt and smoothies, but they're building a massive collider in Europe to search for a strawberry banana that can be eaten whole.

Title: Chicken Pox and Name Statistics
Mouseover text: People with all six of those names agree that it's weird that we have teeth, when you think about it for too long. Just about everyone agrees on that, except—in a still-unexplained statistical anomaly—people named "Trevor."

Title: Super Bowl Watch Party
Mouseover text: It's going to be weird near the end of May when the screen goes blank for over 18 hours.

Title: Backpack Decisions
Mouseover text: "This one is perfect in every way, except that for some reason it's woven from a tungsten mesh, so it weighs 85 pounds and I'll need to carry it around on a hand cart." "That seems like a bad--" "BUT IT HAS THE PERFECT POCKET ARRANGEMENT!"

Title: The History of Unicode
Mouseover text: 2048: "Great news for Maine—we're once again an independent state!!! Thanks, @unicode, for ruling in our favor and sending troops to end New Hampshire's annexation. 🙏🚁🎖️"

Title: Impostor Syndrome
Mouseover text: It's actually worst in people who study the Dunning–Kruger effect. We tried to organize a conference on it, but the only people who would agree to give the keynote were random undergrads.

Title: Robots
Mouseover text: Don't be nervous about the robots, be nervous about the people with the resources to build them.

Title: Unification
Mouseover text: For a while, some physicists worked on a theory unifying the other forces with both the force of gravity and the film "Gravity," but even after Alfonso Cuarón was held in a deep underground chamber of water for 10^31 years he refused to sell his film to Disney.

Title: 2018 CVE List
Mouseover text: CVE-2018-?????: It turns out Bruce Schneier is just two mischevious kids in a trenchcoat.

Title: Self-Driving Issues
Mouseover text: If most people turn into muderers all of a sudden, we'll need to push out a firmware update or something.

Title: The Simpsons
Mouseover text: In-universe, Bart Simpson and Harry Potter were the same age in 1990. Bart is perpetually 10 years old because of a spell put on his town by someone trying to keep him from getting his Hogwarts letter.

Title: Code Golf
Mouseover text: I also enjoy Reverse Regular Golf. I've been playing for years all across the country and I'm still on the first hole.

Title: Interaction
Mouseover text: [They do not move.]

Title: Generations

Title: Namespace Land Rush
Mouseover text: You can also just mash the keyboard at random, but you might end up with a gibberish name no one can pronounce.

Title: Spatial Orientation

My plane banner company gets business by flying around with a banner showing a
tag, waiting for a web developer to get frustrated enough to order a matching
.

Title: Smart Home Security
