Title: Violin Plots
Mouseover text: Strictly speaking, 'violin' refers to the internal structure of the data. The external portion visible in the plot is called the 'viola.'

Title: Robot Future
Mouseover text: I mean, we already live in a world of flying robots killing people. I don't worry about how powerful the machines are, I worry about who the machines give power to.

Title: Not Available
Mouseover text: If my country ever picks a new national flag, this is on my shortlist for designs to argue for, but I think in the end I'll go with the green puzzle piece or broken image thumbnail.

Title: Name Dominoes
Mouseover text: In competition, you can only play a name if you know who the person is. No fair saying "Frank ... Johnson. That sounds like a real person! Let me just Google him real quick."

Title: Personal Data
Mouseover text: Do I just leave money in my mailbox? How much? How much money do they need, anyway? I guess it probably depends how the economy is doing. If stocks go up, should I leave more money in my mailbox or less?

Title: Autogyros
Mouseover text: I understand modern autogyros are much more stable, so I've probably angered the autogyro people by impugning their safety. Once they finish building the autogyros they've been working on in their garages for 10 years, they'll come after me.

Title: Star Lore
Mouseover text: That one is a variable star which pulses every 30 seconds. Its name comes from a Greek word meaning "smoke alarm."

Title: Conversational Dynamics
Mouseover text: "You should make it so people can search for and jump into hundreds of conversations at once if they want." "Ooh, good idea! I imagine only the most well-informed people with the most critical information to share will use that feature."

Title: Right Click
Mouseover text: Right-click or long press (where supported) to save!

Title: Friendly Questions
Mouseover text: Just tell me everything you're thinking about in order from most important to last, and then we'll be friends and we can eat apples together.

Title: Paperwork
Mouseover text: Plus, the photo was geotagged, my unlocked password manager was visible on the laptop, AND you could see my naked reflection in the dark part of the screen.

Title: Congressional Testimony
Mouseover text: James Cameron's Terminator 3 was the REALLY prophetic one. That's why Skynet sent a robot back to the 1990s to prevent him from ever making it, ultimately handing the franchise over to other directors.

Title: History
Mouseover text: HISTORIANS: We've decided to trim the past down to make things more manageable. Using BCE/CE, would you rather we lose the odd-numbered or even-numbered years?

Title: Turkish Delight
Mouseover text: I take it Narnia doesn't have Cinnabons? Because if you can magic up a plate of those, I'll betray whoever.

Title: Rickrolling Anniversary
Mouseover text: Want to feel old? The 'want to feel old?' factoid meme dates back to around 2011, closer to the Bush/Kerry election than to today.

Title: Evangelism
Mouseover text: The wars between the "OTHER PRIMATES OPEN THEM FROM THE SMALL END" faction versus the "BUT THE LITTLE BIT OF BANANA AT THE SMALL END IS GROSS" faction consumed Europe for generations.

Title: Clutter
Mouseover text: I found a copy of The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up, but the idea of reading it didn't spark joy, so I gave it away.

Title: Misinterpretation
Mouseover text: "But there are seven billion people in the world! I can't possibly stop to consider how ALL of them might interpret something!" "Ah, yes, there's no middle ground between 'taking personal responsibility for the thoughts and feelings of every single person on Earth' and 'covering your eyes and ears and yelling logically correct statements into the void.' That's a very insightful point and not at all inane."

Title: Meteorologist
Mouseover text: Hi, I'm your new meteorologist and a former software developer. Hey, when we say 12pm, does that mean the hour from 12pm to 1pm, or the hour centered on 12pm? Or is it a snapshot at 12:00 exactly? Because our 24-hour forecast has midnight at both ends, and I'm worried we have an off-by-one error.

Title: River Border
Mouseover text: I'm not a lawyer, but I believe zones like this are technically considered the high seas, so if you cut a pizza into a spiral there you could be charged with pieracy under marinaritime law.

Title: Python Environment
Mouseover text: The Python environmental protection agency wants to seal it in a cement chamber, with pictorial messages to future civilizations warning them about the danger of using sudo to install random Python packages.

Title: Containers
Mouseover text: All services are microservices if you ignore most of their features.

Title: IMHO
Mouseover text: "Ugh, TMI." "Yeah, that's some tantalizing meat info."

Title: Driving Cars
Mouseover text: It's probably just me. If driving were as dangerous as it seems, hundreds of people would be dying every day!

Title: Research Areas by Size and Countedness
Mouseover text: Mathematicians give a third answer on the vertical axis, "That question is poorly defined, but we have a sub-field devoted to every plausible version of it."

Title: SafetySat
Mouseover text: During launch, in the event of an unexpected sensor reading, SafetySat will extend prongs in all directions to secure itself and any other cubesats safely in the launch vehicle until the source of the problem can be determined.

Title: Fatal Crash Rate
Mouseover text: Fixating on this seems unhealty. But in general, the more likely I think a crash is, the less likely one becomes, which is a strange kind of reverse placebo effect.

Title: Repairs
Mouseover text: I was just disassembling it over the course of five hours so it would fit in the trash more efficiently.

Title: MC Hammer Age
Mouseover text: Wait, sorry, I got mixed up--he's actually almost 50. It's the kid from The Karate Kid who just turned 40.

Title: Morning News
Mouseover text: Support your local paper, unless it's just been bought by some sinister hedge fund or something, which it probably has.

Title: Business Update
Mouseover text: Our customers keep sending us their personal information, even though we've repeatedly asked them to stop. The EU told me I'm the heir to some ancient European throne that makes me exempt from the GDPR, but we should probably still try to fix that.

Title: GDPR
Mouseover text: By clicking anywhere, scrolling, or closing this notification, you agree to be legally bound by the witch Sycorax within a cloven pine.

Title: Selection Effect
Mouseover text: fMRI testing showed that subjects who don't agree to participate are much more likely to escape from the machine mid-scan.

Title: xkcd Phone 2000
Mouseover text: Our retina display features hundreds of pixels per inch in the central fovea region.

Title: Clickbait-Corrected p-Value
Mouseover text: When comparing hypotheses with Bayesian methods, the similar 'clickbayes factor' can account for some harder-to-quantify priors.

Title: LeBron James and Stephen Curry
Mouseover text: The 538TR attempts to capture a player's combined skill at basketball (either real-life or NBA 2K18) and election forecasting.

Title: Presidential Succession
Mouseover text: Ties are broken by whoever was closest to the surface of Europa when they were born.

Title: Sun and Earth
Mouseover text: But we don't need to worry about the boiling masses sandwiching the thin layer in which we live, since we're so fragile and short-lived that it's unlikely to kill us before something else does! Wait, why doesn't that sound reassuring?

Title: Attention Span
Mouseover text: I didn't even realize they MADE a novelization of "Surf Ninjas." How did you-- Oh my god, it's signed by the author?!

Title: Customer Rewards
Mouseover text: We'll pay you $1.47 to post on social media about our products, $2.05 to mention it in any group chats you're in, and 11 cents per passenger each time you drive your office carpool past one of our billboards.

Title: Brookhaven RHIC
Mouseover text: "Buddy, you trying to pull something? I can't buy this gold--all the electrons are missing. I could face serious charges!"

Title: Irony Definition
Mouseover text: Can you stop glaring at me like that? It makes me feel really ironic.

Title: Hertzsprung-Russell Diagram
Mouseover text: The Hertzsprung-Russell diagram is located in its own lower right corner, unless you're viewing it on an unusually big screen.

Title: Update Notes
Mouseover text: v3.0.2: Hey, if anyone still using this app is headed to the beach, can you stop at 4th and River St and grab the sunscreen from my car? Trunk should be unlocked. Thanks!

Title: Newton's Trajectories
Mouseover text: With just one extra line, he could have anticipated the 2003 film The Core, but some things are too audacious for even the greatest visionaries.

Title: Thorough Analysis
Mouseover text: The likely shape of the bells was determined through consultation with several bellringing experts at the Tower of London. Transcripts of those interviews are available in Appendix VII.

Title: Rock
Mouseover text: It traveled so far to reach me. I owed it my best.

Title: JWST Delays
Mouseover text: Since delays should get less likely closer to the launch, most astronomers in 2018 believed the expansion of the schedule was slowing, but by early 2020 new measurements indicated that it was actually accelerating.

Title: New Phone Thread
Mouseover text: I'm going to tell the manufacturer that their business practices are ADMIRABLE and ETHICAL and their developers are ATTRACTIVE and I'm going to report them to the FCC for their IMPECCABLE VIRTUE.

Title: OEIS Submissions
Mouseover text: SUB[59]: The submission numbers for my accepted OEIS submissions in chronological order

Title: Stargazing 2
Mouseover text: I mean, it wasn't exactly MY thesis. When the FAA came to shut down our observatory for using the telescope mirror to shine light at airplanes, I took a thesis and a bunch of doctorates from the supply cabinet on my way out.

Title: Wall Art
Mouseover text: At first, I moved from pokémon posters to regular oil paintings, but then these really grumpy and unreasonable detectives from the Louvre showed up and took them all. They wouldn't even give me back my thumbtacks!

Title: An Apple for a Dollar
Mouseover text: I'd like 0.4608 apples, please.

Title: Negative Results
Mouseover text: P.S. We're going to the beach this weekend, so I'm attaching my preregistration forms for that trip now, before we find out whether it produces any interesting results.

Title: Software Development
Mouseover text: Update: It turns out the cannon has a motorized base, and can make holes just fine using the barrel itself as a battering ram. But due to design constraints it won't work without a projectile loaded in, so we still need those drills.

Title: Sports Champions
Mouseover text: For a long time, people thought maybe Usain Bolt was the one for running, until the 2090s and the incredible dominance of Derek Legs.

Title: Y-Axis
Mouseover text: We've also developed the semi-semi-log scale, where the Y-axis for the left half of the graph is a log scale but on the right half it isn't.

Title: Light Hacks
Mouseover text: Life hack: Wait for an advanced civilization to be briefly distracted, then sneak in and construct a slightly smaller Dyson sphere inside theirs.

Title: Peer Review
Mouseover text: Your manuscript "Don't Pay $25 to Access Any of the Articles in this Journal: A Review of Preprint Repositories and Author Willingness to Email PDF Copies for Free" has also been rejected, but nice try.

Title: Heat Index
Mouseover text: The heat index is calculated via looking up the "effective temperature" in a table of air temperature and humidity values, and then adding a bunch more degrees because it feels WAY hotter than that.

Title: Lightning Distance
Mouseover text: The index of radio refraction does have a lot of variation, which might throw off your calculations, so you can also look at the difference in brightness between the visible flash and more-attenuated UV and x-rays.

Title: Complex Numbers
Mouseover text: I'm trying to prove that mathematics forms a meta-abelian group, which would finally confirm my suspicions that algebraic geometry and geometric algebra are the same thing.

Title: Disaster Movie
Mouseover text: Really, they'd be rushing around collecting revisions to go into the next scheduled quarterly public data update, not publishing them immediately, but you have to embellish things a little for Hollywood.

Title: Voting Software
Mouseover text: There are lots of very smart people doing fascinating work on cryptographic voting protocols. We should be funding and encouraging them, and doing all our elections with paper ballots until everyone currently working in that field has retired.

Title: Pie Charts
Mouseover text: If you can't get your graphing tool to do the shading, just add some clip art of cosmologists discussing the unusual curvature of space in the area.

Title: Word Puzzles
Mouseover text: Eno's storied aria was once soloed by Judge Lance Ito on the alto oboe at Ohio's AirAsia Arena.

Title: Repair or Replace
Mouseover text: Just make sure all your friends and family are out of the car, or that you've made backup friends and family at home.

Title: Equations
Mouseover text: All electromagnetic equations: The same as all fluid dynamics equations, but with the 8 and 23 replaced with the permittivity and permeability of free space, respectively.

Title: Dark Matter Candidates
Mouseover text: My theory is that dark matter is actually just a thin patina of grime covering the whole universe, and we don't notice it because we haven't thoroughly cleaned the place in eons.

Title: Edgelord
Mouseover text: If you study graphs in which edges can link more than two nodes, you're more properly called a hyperedgelord.

Title: Supreme Court Bracket
Mouseover text: My bracket was busted in the first round; I had Massachusetts v. Connecticut in the final, probably in a case over who gets to annex Rhode Island.

Title: Hazard Symbol
Mouseover text: The warning diamond on the Materials Safety Data Sheet for this stuff just has the "😰" emoji in all four fields.

Title: Begging the Question
Mouseover text: At least we can all agree on the enormity of this usage.

Title: Sibling-in-Law
Mouseover text: FYI, it turns out "...because I haven't figured out whether he would be my brother-in-law or not" does NOT qualify as a "reason why these two should not be wed."

Title: Frontiers
Mouseover text: Star Trek V is a small part of the space frontier, but it's been a while since that movie came out so I assume we've finished exploring it by now.

Title: Rolle's Theorem
Mouseover text: I mean, if it's that easy to get a theorem named for you ... "a straight line that passes through the center of a coplanar circle always divides the circle into two equal halves." Can I have that one? Wait, can I auction off the naming rights? It can be the Red Bull Theorem or the Quicken Loans Theorem, depending who wants it more.

Title: Boathouses and Houseboats
Mouseover text: The <x> that is held by <y> is also a <y><x>, so if you go to a food truck, the stuff you buy is truck food. A phone that's in your car is a carphone, and a car equipped with a phone is a phonecar. When you play a mobile racing game, you're in your phonecar using your carphone to drive a different phonecar. I'm still not sure about bananaphones.

Title: Sandboxing Cycle
Mouseover text: All I want is a secure system where it's easy to do anything I want. Is that so much to ask?

Title: Social Media Announcement
Mouseover text: Why I'm Moving Most of My Social Activity to Slack, Then Creating a Second Slack to Avoid the People in the First One, Then Giving Up on Social Interaction Completely, Then Going Back to Texting

Title: Trum-
Mouseover text: Excited to vote for future presidents Bill Eisenhamper, Amy Forb, Ethan Obample, and Abigail Washingtoast.

Title: Beverages
Mouseover text: If I wait a while, it's not so bad, because then it's just shaped like me, plus some pipes and tanks and probably eventually all of Earth's oceans.

Title: Curve-Fitting
Mouseover text: Cauchy-Lorentz: "Something alarmingly mathematical is happening, and you should probably pause to Google my name and check what field I originally worked in."

Title: Unfulfilling Toys
Mouseover text: We were going to do a falling-apart Rubik's cube that was just 27 independent blocks stuck together with magnets, but then we realized it was actually really cool and even kind of worked, so we cut that one.

Title: 6/6 Time
Mouseover text: You know how Einstein figured out that the speed of light was constant, and everything else had to change for consistency? My theory is like his, except not smart or good.

Title: Bad Opinions
Mouseover text: I thought of another bad opinion! I couldn't find anyone who expressed it specifically, but still, the fact that I can so easily imagine it is infuriating! I'm gonna tell everyone about it!

Title: Stanislav Petrov Day
Mouseover text: I was going to get you an alarm clock that occasionally goes off randomly in the middle of the night, but you can ignore it and go back to sleep and it's fine.

Title: Incoming Calls
Mouseover text: I wonder if that friendly lady ever fixed the problem she was having with her headset.

Title: Data Pipeline
Mouseover text: "Is the pipeline literally running from your laptop?" "Don't be silly, my laptop disconnects far too often to host a service we rely on. It's running on my phone."

Title: Bluetooth
Mouseover text: Bluetooth is actually named for the tenth-century Viking king Harald "Bluetooth" Gormsson, but the protocol developed by Harald was a wireless charging standard unrelated to the modern Bluetooth except by name.

Title: Horror Movies
Mouseover text: "Isn't the original Jurassic Park your favorite movie of all time?" "Yes, but that's because I like dinosaurs and I WANT there to be an island full of them. If John Hammond's lab had been breeding serial killers in creepy masks, I wouldn't have watched!" "Wait, are you sure? That could actually be good." "Ok, I WOULD watch the scenes where Jeff Goldblum tries to convince a bunch of executives that the park is a bad idea."

Title: Internal Monologues
Mouseover text: Haha, just kidding, everyone's already been hacked. I wonder if today's the day we find out about it.

Title: Rock Wall
Mouseover text: I don't trust mantle/core geologists because I suspect that, if they ever get a chance to peel away the Earth's crust, they'll do it in a heartbeat.

Title: Modified Bayes' Theorem
Mouseover text: Don't forget to add another term for "probability that the Modified Bayes' Theorem is correct."

Title: Hygrometer
Mouseover text: I'm working on assembling a combination declinometer, sclerometer, viscometer, aleurometer, stalagmometer, and hypsometer. I'm making good progress according to my ometerometer, a device which shows the rate at which I'm acquiring measurement devices.

Title: Tectonics Game
Mouseover text: They're limiting the playtesters to type A3 V stars, so the games will all end before the Sun consumes the Earth.

Title: Barnard's Star
Mouseover text: "Ok, team. We have a little under 10,000 years before closest approach to figure out how to destroy Barnard's Star." "Why, does it pose a threat to the Solar System?" "No. It's just an asshole."

Title: Carnot Cycle
Mouseover text: The Carnot cycle is more properly known by its full title, the "Carnot-Tolkien-Wagner Ring Cycle."

Title: I'm a Car
Mouseover text: I'm the proud parent of an honor student, and the person driving me is proud, too!

Title: Who Sends the First Text?
Mouseover text: I sort of wish my texting app showed the percentage next to each person, but also sort of don't want to know.

Title: Ballot Selfies
Mouseover text: There were actually some good reasons for those laws, but IMO they now do more harm than good. Which raises a question: If there's a ballot measure to strike them down, how can I resist the urge to take a picture of my "yes" vote?

Title: Election Night
Mouseover text: "Even the blind—those who are anxious to hear, but are not able to see—will be taken care of. Immense megaphones have been constructed and will be in use at The Tribune office and in the Coliseum. The one at the Coliseum will be operated by a gentleman who draws $60 a week from Barnum & Bailey's circus for the use of his voice."

Title: Wishlist
Mouseover text: Disappointed that they caved to fan pressure and went with Ruth Bader Ginsburg over Elena Kagan.

Title: Trig Identities
Mouseover text: ARCTANGENT THETA = ENCHANT AT TARGET

Title: Indirect Detection
Mouseover text: I'm like a prisoner in Plato's Cave, seeing only the shade you throw on the wall.

Title: Evaluating Tech Things
Mouseover text: Also known as the Black Mirror-Mythbusters scale.

Title: Kilogram
Mouseover text: I'm glad to hear they're finally redefining the meter to be exactly three feet.

Title: Airplanes and Spaceships
Mouseover text: Despite having now taken three months longer than the airplane people, we're making disappointingly little progress toward the obvious next stage of vehicle: The Unobtanium-hulled tunneling ship from the 2003 film 'The Core.'

Title: Update Your Address
Mouseover text: This is my four-digit PIN. It was passed down to me by my father, and someday I will pass it on to you. Unless we figure out how to update it, but that sounds complicated.

Title: Horror Movies 2
Mouseover text: When I was a kid, someone told me the end of The Giver was ambiguous, which surprised me. I had just assumed Jonah died--because the book had a medal on the cover, and I knew grown-ups liked stories where sad stuff happens at the end for no reason.

Title: Heist
Mouseover text: But he has a hat AND a toolbox! Where could someone planning a heist get THOSE?

Title: Popper
Mouseover text: At least, I don't think there's evidence. My claim that there's no evidence hasn't been falsified. At least, not that I know of.

Title: Alpha Centauri
Mouseover text: And let's be honest, it's more like two and a half stars. Proxima is barely a star and barely bound to the system.

Title: Cohort and Age Effects
Mouseover text: Younger people get very few joint replacements, yet they're also getting more than older people did at the same age. This means you can choose between 'Why are millennials getting so (many/few) joint replacements?' depending on which trend fits your current argument better.

Title: Middle Latitudes
Mouseover text: Snowy blizzards are fun, but so are warm sunny beaches, so we split the difference by having lots of icy wet slush!

Title: Mercator Projection
Mouseover text: The other great lakes are just water on the far side of Canada Island. If you drive north from the Pacific northwest you actually cross directly into Alaska, although a few officials--confused by the Mercator distortion--have put up border signs.

Title: Laptop Issues
Mouseover text: Hang on, we got a call from the feds. They say we can do whatever with him, but the EPA doesn't want that laptop in the ocean. They're sending a team.

Title: FDR
Mouseover text: June 21st, 365, the date of the big Mediterranean earthquake and tsunami, lived in infamy for a few centuries before fading. Maybe the trick is a catchy rhyme; the '5th of November' thing is still going strong over 400 years later.

Title: arXiv
Mouseover text: Both arXiv and archive.org are invaluable projects which, if they didn't exist, we would dismiss as obviously ridiculous and unworkable.

Title: History Department
Mouseover text: When we take into account the recent discovery of previously-unstudied history in the 1750s, this year may have been an outright loss.

Title: Rocket Launch
Mouseover text: NASA tries to coordinate launch timing with the Care Bears' cloud castle, but unfortunately sometimes collisions with stray Care Bears are unavoidable, so they just try to make the fairings sturdy and hope for a glancing impact.

Title: Schwarzschild's Cat
Mouseover text: Cats can be smaller than the critical limit, but they're unobservable. If one shrinks enough that it crosses the limit, it just appears to get cuter and cuter as it slowly fades from view.

Title: Christmas Eve Eve
Mouseover text: It turns out that saying "Oh, so THAT'S why they call it Boxing Day" is a good way to get punched a second time.

Title: Feathered Dinosaur Venn Diagram
Mouseover text: My pet theory is that in real life, the kid at the beginning of Jurassic Park who made fun of the 'six-foot turkey' never got a talking-to from Dr. Grant, and grew up to produce several of the movie's sequels.

Title: Million, Billion, Trillion
Mouseover text: You can tell most people don’t really assign an absolute meaning to these numbers because in some places and time periods, “billion” has meant 1,000x what it's meant in others, and a lot of us never even noticed.

Title: Consensus New Year
Mouseover text: The biggest jump is at 11:00am EST (4:00pm UTC) when midnight reaches the UTC+8 time zone. That time zone, which includes China, is home to a quarter of the world's population. India and Sri Lanka (UTC+5:30) put us over the 50% mark soon after.

Title: Reminders
Mouseover text: The good news is that if the number of work and friend relationships you have exceeds your willingness to do the bare minimum to keep up with everyone's life events and stuff, one way or another that problem eventually solves itself.

Title: Short Selling
Mouseover text: "I'm selling all my analogies at auction tomorrow, and that witch over there will give you 20 beans if you promise on pain of death to win them for her." "What if SEVERAL people promised witches they'd win, creating some kind of a ... squeeze? Gosh, you could make a lot of–" "Don't be silly! That probably never happens."

Title: Marsiforming
Mouseover text: It has so many advantages--it preserves Martian life, requires fewer interplanetary launches, and makes it much easier to field-test Mars rovers.

Title: Mattresses
Mouseover text: After reading that "The War To Sell You A Mattress Is An Internet Nightmare" article, I've decided it's safer and less complicated to just sleep on the floor. DISCLOSURE: THE AUTHOR OF THIS MOUSEOVER TEXT RECEIVED FINANCIAL COMPENSATION FROM THE FLOOR INDUSTRY FOR THIS MESSAGE.

Title: Thor Tools
Mouseover text: CORRECTION: After careful evaluation, we have determined that the axis label on this chart was printed backward.

Title: Magnetic Pole
Mouseover text: People keep trying to come up with reasons that we should worry about the magnetic field collapsing or reversing, but honestly I think it's fine. Whatever minor problems it causes will be made up for by the mid-latitude auroras.

Title: Missal of Silos
Mouseover text: Welcome to Wyoming, motto "We'd like to clarify that Cheyenne Mountain is in Colorado."

Title: Models of the Atom
Mouseover text: J.J. Thompson won a Nobel Prize for his work in electricity in gases, but was unfairly passed over for his "An atom is plum pudding, and plum pudding is MADE of atoms! Duuuuude." theory.

Title: Technical Analysis
Mouseover text: "I [suspect] that we are throwing more and more of our resources, including the cream of our youth, into financial activities remote from the production of goods and services, into activities that generate high private rewards disproportionate to their social productivity. I suspect that the immense power of the computer is being harnessed to this 'paper economy', not to do the same transactions more economically but to balloon the quantity and variety of financial exchanges." --James Tobin, July 1984

Title: Internet Archive
Mouseover text: The fact that things like the npm left-pad incident are so rare is oddly reassuring.

Title: Midcontinent Rift System
Mouseover text: The best wedge issue is an actual wedge.

Title: Biff Tannen
Mouseover text: I can't help myself; now I want to read a bunch of thinkpieces from newspapers in Biff's 1985 arguing over whether the growth of the region into a corporate dystopia was inevitable.

Title: Modern OSI Model
Mouseover text: In retrospect, I shouldn't have used each layer of the OSI model as one of my horcruxes.

Title: Sharing Options
Mouseover text: How about posts that are public, but every time a company accesses a bunch of them, the API makes their CEO's account click 'like' on one of them at random so you get a notification.

Title: Launch Risk
Mouseover text: Don't worry--you're less likely to die from a space launch than from a shark attack. The survival rate is pretty high for both!

Title: Carbonated Beverage Language Map
Mouseover text: There's one person in Missouri who says "carbo bev" who the entire rest of the country HATES.

Title: Invisible Formatting
Mouseover text: To avoid errors like this, we render all text and pipe it through OCR before processing, fixing a handful of irregular bugs by burying them beneath a smooth, uniform layer of bugs.

Title: Opportunity Rover
Mouseover text: Thanks for bringing us along.

Title: Night Shift
Mouseover text: Help, I set my white balance wrong and suddenly everyone is screaming at each other about whether they've been to Colorado.

Title: Physics Suppression
Mouseover text: If physics had a mafia, I'm pretty sure the BICEP2 mess would have ended in bloodshed.

Title: Launch Conditions
Mouseover text: Though I do think the tiny vent on one of the boosters labeled "O-RING" is in poor taste.

Title: Plutonium
Mouseover text: It's like someone briefly joined the team running the universe, introduced their idea for a cool mechanic, then left, and now everyone is stuck pretending that this wildly unbalanced dynamic makes sense.

Title: .NORM Normal File Format
Mouseover text: At some point, compression becomes an  aesthetic design choice. Luckily, SVG is a really flexible format, so there's no reason it can't support vector JPEG artifacts.

Title: Differentiation and Integration
Mouseover text: "Symbolic integration" is when you theatrically go through the motions of finding integrals, but the actual result you get doesn't matter because it's purely symbolic.

Title: Normal Distribution
Mouseover text: It's the NORMAL distribution, not the TANGENT distribution.

Title: Video Orientation
Mouseover text: CIRCULAR VIDEO - PROS: Solves aspect ratio problem. CONS: Never trust anyone who talks to you from inside a circle.

Title: Brain Hemispheres
Mouseover text: Neurologically speaking, the LEFT hand is actually the one at the end of the RIGHT arm.

Title: Light Pollution
Mouseover text: It's so sad how almost no one alive today can remember seeing the galactic rainbow, the insanity nebula, or the skull and glowing eyes of the Destroyer of Sagittarius.

Title: Size Venn Diagram
Mouseover text: Terms I'm going to start using: The Large Dipper, great potatoes, the Big Hadron Collider, and Large Orphan Annie.

Title: Meta Collecting
Mouseover text: I'm trying to get the page locked because some jerk keeps adding "Yachts".

Title: Space Mission Hearing
Mouseover text: Our grant application contains one of those little greeting card speakers that plays spaceship noises when you open it.

Title: Luna 2
Mouseover text: The flags were probably vaporized on impact, because we launched it before we had finished figuring out how to land. That makes sense from an engineering standpoint, but also feels like a metaphor.

Title: Google Trends Maps
Mouseover text: It's early 2020. The entire country is gripped with Marco Rubio fever except for Alaska, which is freaking out. You're frantically studying up on etiquette and/or sexting.

Title: Panama Canal
Mouseover text: Once they selected the other proposal, we could have kept shopping ours around, but we would had to modify it include an aqueduct over their canal, which would be totally unreasonable.

Title: New Robot
Mouseover text: "Some worry that we'll soon have a surplus of search and rescue robots, compared to the number of actual people in situations requiring search and rescue. That's where our other robot project comes in..."

Title: 1921 Fact Checker
Mouseover text: POLITIFACT SAYS: MOSTLY WHATEVER

Title: Industry Nicknames
Mouseover text: As far as "being in the pocket of Big Egg" goes, I think the real threat is Chansey.

Title: Emojidome
Mouseover text: Thank you to the xkcd April 1st volunteers/commentators, including @Chromakode, Kevin, @Aiiane, Patrick, Kat, Reuven, @cotrone, @bstaffin, @zigdon, schwal, Stereo, and everyone who voted!

Title: Percentage Styles
Mouseover text: In a tribute to classical Latin, I started pronouncing it 'per-kent.' Eventually my friends had to resort to spritzing me with a water bottle like a cat to train me out of it.

Title: EHT Black Hole Picture
Mouseover text: [five years later] Ok, it seems we were accidentally zoomed in slightly too far. But imagine there's a cool-looking twisted accretion disc just outside this black square!

Title: Too Much Talking
Mouseover text: Next time I go, I'm going to prepare a whole bunch of opinions that I'm sure are good, and make everyone sit quietly while I run through them.

Title: M87 Black Hole Size Comparison
Mouseover text: I think Voyager 1 would be just past the event horizon, but slightly less than halfway to the bright ring.

Title: Election Commentary
Mouseover text: This really validates Jones's strategy of getting several thousand more votes than Smith. In retrospect, that was a smart move; those votes were crucial.

Title: Text Entry
Mouseover text: I like to think that somewhere out there, there's someone whose personal quest is lobbying TV providers to add an option to switch their on-screen keyboards to Dvorak.

Title: Wanna See the Code?
Mouseover text: And because if you just leave it there, it's going to start contaminating things downstream even if no one touches it directly.

Title: Email Settings
Mouseover text: What are all these less-than signs? What's an HREF? Look, we know you live in a fancy futuristic tech world, but not all of us have upgraded to the latest from Sun Microsystems.

Title: Reinvent the Wheel
Mouseover text: Right now it's a bicycle wheel, so we've had to move to lighter vehicles, but the reduced overhead is worth it. There was one week when a wheel of cheese got dangerously close to the first page, though.

Title: UI vs UX
Mouseover text: U[unprintable glyph]: The elements a higher power uses to bend that moral arc. U[even more unprintable glyph]: The higher power's overall experience bending that moral arc.

Title: Dangerous Fields
Mouseover text: Eventually, every epidemiologist becomes another statistic, a dedication to record-keeping which their colleagues sincerely appreciate.

Title: Disk Usage
Mouseover text: Menu -> Manage -> [Optimize space usage, Encrypt disk usage report, Convert photos to text-only, Delete temporary files, Delete permanent files, Delete all files currently in use, Optimize menu options, Download cloud, Optimize cloud , Upload unused space to cloud]

Title: Adjusting a Chair
Mouseover text: When I was looking at the box, I should have thought more about what "360 degrees of freedom" meant.

Title: Heists And Escapes
Mouseover text: The interactive experience is built on a single theological framework that unites Dante, George R. R. Martin, every major heist movie, and Erin Gloria Ryan's "Kevin is dead" Home Alone theory.

Title: Waiting for the But
Mouseover text: Listen, I'm not a fan of the Spanish Inquisition OR predatory multi-level marketing schemes...

Title: Appendicitis
Mouseover text: Fortunately, after a brief skirmish, I seem to have gained the upper hand in the battle against my internal organs, at least until they learn to read and find out the mean stuff I've said about them.

Title: Cubesat Launch
Mouseover text: Luckily, the damages were partly offset by the prize money we got from accidentally winning the nearby water skiing championship tournament.

Title: Alternate Histories
Mouseover text: "So their universe wouldn't have the iconic photo of a screaming Truman being hoisted aloft by the newspaper-printing machinery..."

Title: XKeyboarCD
Mouseover text: The key caps use LCD displays for all the vowels, so they can automatically adjust over the years to reflect ongoing vowel shifts while allowing you to keep typing phonetically.

Title: A/B
Mouseover text: We wrote our site in Linear A rather than Aksara Kawi because browser testing showed that Crete script rendered faster than Java script.

Title: Westerns
Mouseover text: Sitting here idly trying to figure out how the population of the Old West in the late 1800s compares to the number of Red Dead Redemption 2 players.

Title: Effects of High Altitude
Mouseover text: If she'd lived in Flagstaff (elevation 6,903 feet), Cruella de Vil would only have needed 89 dalmatians for her coat.

Title: Motivation
Mouseover text: What's even worse is, a month ago they transferred me to work on the game I was already playing, and suddenly I found myself procrastinating by playing the one I'd been assigned before. It's possible they're onto me and this is all part of the plan.

Title: Swimming
Mouseover text: "You don't know how high above you the sky goes, but you're not freaking out about that." "Well, NOW I am!"

Title: Ufo
Mouseover text: "It's a little low for a weather balloon; it might be some other kind." "Yeah. Besides, I know I'm the alien conspiracy guy, but come on--the idea that the government would care about hiding something so mundane as atmospheric temperature measurement is too ridiculous even for me."

Title: Diploma Legal Notes
Mouseover text: If you're planning to challenge the royal family, you should probably wait 6-8 weeks, since a number of the younger ones have diplomas and Kate was actually on the varsity lightsaber team at St Andrews.

Title: Qualifiers
Mouseover text: [20 minutes later] ", hi."

Title: Comments
Mouseover text: NPR encourages you to add comments to their stories using the page inspector in your browser's developer tools. Note: Your comments are visible only to you, and will be lost when you refresh the page.

Title: Ken Burns Theory
Mouseover text: Some of the KBCU ancillary works try a little too hard to tie everything together. Doris Kearns Goodwin, the sports journalist featured in "Baseball," was somehow ALSO a famous historian who wrote bestselling biographies of Lincoln AND Johnson? Unrealistic.

Title: An Apple a Day
Mouseover text: Even the powerful, tart Granny Smith cultivar is proving ineffective against new Gran-negative doctors.

Title: Literary Opinions
Mouseover text: If I really focus, I can distinguish between John Steinbeck and John Updike, or between Gore Vidal and Vidal Sassoon, but not both at once.

Title: Chernobyl
Mouseover text: You know when you can't hear your speakers, and you keep turning various volume controls up higher and higher in confusion, and then someone hits the mute button and there's a deafening blast of sound? That's basically what happened at Chernobyl.

Title: Glacier
Mouseover text: The Norwegian adaptation of The Sword in the Stone takes things in a weird direction.

Title: Millennials
Mouseover text: Ironically, I've been having these same arguments for at least a decade now. I thought we would have moved on by now, but somehow the snide complaints about millennials continue.

Title: Stack
Mouseover text: Gotta feel kind of bad for nation-state hackers who spend years implanting and cultivating some hardware exploit, only to discover the entire target database is already exposed to anyone with a web browser.

Title: Motivated Reasoning Olympics
Mouseover text: [later] I can't believe how bad corruption has become, especially given that our league split off from the statewide one a month ago SPECIFICALLY to protest this kind of flagrantly biased judging.

Title: Reading in the Original
Mouseover text: The articles are much shorter, but I assume that's because this version predates the merger with the Hawaiian text that created the modern Hawaiian-Greek hybrid wiki-pedia.

Title: Predictive Models
Mouseover text: WE WILL ARREST THE REVOLUTION MEMBERS [AT THE JULY 28TH MEETING][tab] "Cancel the meeting! Our cover is blown."

Title: Coordinate Precision
Mouseover text: 40 digits: You are optimistic about our understanding of the nature of distance itself.

Title: Shadow Biosphere
Mouseover text: The typical Shadow Biology Department is housed in a building coated in a thin layer of desert varnish which renders it invisible to normal-world university staff.

Title: Lunar Cycles
Mouseover text: The Antikythera mechanism had a whole set of gears specifically to track the cyclic popularity of skinny jeans and low-rise waists.

Title: Trained a Neural Net
Mouseover text: It also works for anything you teach someone else to do. "Oh yeah, I trained a pair of neural nets, Emily and Kevin, to respond to support tickets."

Title: First News Memory
Mouseover text: Psychology researchers say our 'flashbulb' memories of big events can be unreliable, but I clearly remember watching live on CNN as Challenger crashed into and destroyed the Berlin Wall.

Title: Flag Interpretation
Mouseover text: When Salvador Dalí died, it took months to get all the flagpoles sufficiently melted.

Title: How Hacking Works
Mouseover text: If only somebody had warned them that the world would roll them like this.

Title: Gastroenterology
Mouseover text: "Mostly it means that I'm acutely aware that the kid one table over coughed as the server walked past with our food."

Title: Expiration Date High Score
Mouseover text: "Wait, we've MOVED since 2010. How on Earth did--" "Look, some of us were just born to be champions."

Title: NWS Warnings
Mouseover text: Kind of rude of them to simultaneously issue an EVACUATION - IMMEDIATE alert, a SHELTER IN PLACE alert, and a 911 TELEPHONE OUTAGE alert.

Title: Spreadsheets
Mouseover text: My brother once asked me if there was a function to produce a calendar grid from a list of dates in Google Sheets. I replied with a single-cell formula that took in a list of dates and outputted a calendar. It used SEQUENCE(), REGEXMATCH(), and a double-nested ARRAYFORMULA(), and it locked up the browser for 15 seconds every time it ran. I think he learned a lot about asking me things.

Title: Inbox
Mouseover text: Rome's declaration of war against Carthage was sent from a no-reply address, so Hannibal had to cross the Alps to deliver his "UNSUBSCRIBE" response in person.

Title: When I'm Back at a Keyboard
Mouseover text: [after typing 1,500 words on feathered dinosaurs, paleontology, sexism, lava, and dinosaurs as animals rather than movie monsters] Sorry to cut it short, I'm on my phone. When I'm back at a keyboard, I can give you another 5,000 words.

Title: Icon Swap
Mouseover text: Someone's probably working on an eBook app where, if you stop reading right before some plot twist happens, the app will wait a while and then send you a breaking news alert about what's happening, prompting you to open it and read the next few pages to learn more.

Title: Unpopular Opinions
Mouseover text: I wasn't a big fan of 3 or Salvation, so I'm trying to resist getting my hopes up too much for Dark Fate, but it's hard. I'm just a sucker for humans and robots traveling through time to try to drive trucks into each other, apparently.

Title: Cumulonimbus
Mouseover text: The rarest of all clouds is the altocumulenticulostratonimbulocirruslenticulomammanoctilucent cloud, caused by an interaction between warm moist air, cool dry air, cold slippery air, cursed air, and a cloud of nanobots.

Title: Dark Matter
Mouseover text: To detect dark matter, we just need to build a bird feeder that spins two squirrels around the rim in opposite directions at relativistic speeds and collides them together.

Title: Geologic Time
Mouseover text: Ok, well, we'll be sure to pay you sometime soon, geologically speaking.

Title: E Scooters
Mouseover text: Obviously battery technology and prices have driven a lot of the scooter explosion, but I feel like Dean Kamen must be at least a little grumpy about how much people laughed at the idea of the Segway.

Title: Old Game Worlds
Mouseover text: Ok, how many coins for a cinnamon roll?

Title: Serena Versus the Drones
Mouseover text: After the test, she said that if she had a choice, she wouldn’t defend herself against drones using a tennis ball and racket, though she would absolutely pick them over other sports equipment. But, she added, "Drones don't bother me."

Title: Conference Question
Mouseover text: I also have an utterance. Less of an utterance and more of an incantation. Less of an incantation and more of a malediction. Less of a malediction and more of a Word of Power. Less of a Word of Power and more of an Unforgivable Curse.

Title: Review
Mouseover text: Controls are a little hard to figure out.

Title: Well-Ordering Principle
Mouseover text: We could organize a nationwide old-photo-album search, but the real Worst McFly is probably lost to time.

Title: How to Send a File
Mouseover text: Note: How To will teach you lots of cool stuff about technology, data storage, butterfly migration, and more. Also you will never see your files again.

Title: Dockless Roombas
Mouseover text: The company started out exploiting a loophole in the law banning scooters. The city was mad at first, but then they noticed how much they were saving on street cleaning.

Title: Nice To E-Meet You
Mouseover text: I'm inside your head and I hate it. Please let me out.

Title: Game Show
Mouseover text: Eventually they agreed to "an auto-retracting dog leash with one end clipped to your house, so you can press the button on the handle and water-ski home."

Title: Cryptic Wifi Networks
Mouseover text: They actually showed up on the first scan by the first WiFi-capable device.

Title: Unreachable State
Mouseover text: ERROR: We've reached an unreachable state. Anything is possible. The limits were in our heads all along. Follow your dreams.

Title: Foucault Pendulum
Mouseover text: Trust me, you don't want to get on the wrong side of the paramilitary enforcement arm of the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service.

Title: Earth-Like Exoplanet
Mouseover text: Fire is actually a potential biosignature, since it means something is filling the atmosphere with an unstable gas like oxygen. If we find a planet covered in flames, it might be an indicator that it supports life. Or used to, anyway, before the fire.

Title: Prescience
Mouseover text: Lots of people called their ships unsinkable before the Titanic. Voicing your hubris doesn't make failure more likely, just more memorable.

Title: Ksp 2
Mouseover text: "The committee appreciates that your 2020 launch is on track, but the 'human capital/personnel retention' budget includes a lot more unmarked cash payments than usual. What are th--" "Public outreach."

Title: Types of Approximation
Mouseover text: It's not my fault I haven't had a chance to measure the curvature of this particular universe.

Title: Mavis Beacon
Mouseover text: There are actually lowercase-like 'oldstyle' forms of normal numbers with more pronounced ascenders and descenders, which is why some numbers like '5' in books sometimes dangle below the line. But the true capital numbers remain the domain of number maven Mavis Beacon.

Title: Math Work
Mouseover text: I could type this into a solver, which MIGHT help, but would also mean I have to get a lot of parentheses right...

Title: Drone Fishing
Mouseover text: Today's consumers who order their drones off the internet don't know the joy of going out in nature and returning with a drone that you caught yourself, whose angry owners you fought off with your own two hands.

Title: Fresh Pears
Mouseover text: I want to sell apples but I'm still working on getting the machine to do the cutting and grafting.

Title: College Athletes
Mouseover text: Their signature play is the three-point combinator, a recursive offense which is guaranteed not to halt and continues accumulating points until the buzzer.

Title: Hours Before Departure
Mouseover text: They could afford to cut it close because they all had Global Entry.

Title: Cell Phone Functions
Mouseover text: ... tazer ... fire extinguisher ... bird feeder ... toilet paper ...

Title: How Old
Mouseover text: We've met! I remember you when you were thiiiis tall! [*holds a hand an inch above their head*]

Title: Chemistry Nobel
Mouseover text: Most chemists thought the lanthanides and actinides could be inserted in the sixth and seventh rows, but no, they're just floating down at the bottom with lots more undiscovered elements all around them.

Title: Faculty:Student Ratio
Mouseover text: They managed to briefly hit the top of the rankings when they rejected everyone except one applicant, published 5 billion research papers that just said "Hi," and hired one of their graduates for $50 trillion/year (then fired them after 10 microseconds.)

Title: Percent Milkfat
Mouseover text: "So what's dark energy?" "Cosmologists and the FDA are both trying very hard to find out."

Title: 53 Cards
Mouseover text: Well, there's one right here at the bottom, where it says "53."

Title: Wardrobe
Mouseover text: If you'd just agree to hold your meetings in here, you'd have PLENTY of time to figure things out before the deadline.

Title: Earthquake Early Warnings
Mouseover text: I was fired by the National Weather Service five minutes after they hired me for going into their code base and renaming all the tornado warnings to "tornado spoiler alerts."

Title: Imagine Going Back in Time
Mouseover text: I wonder what the trendy adults in 2019 who are too cool for Pokemon will be into. Probably Digimon!

Title: Emulation
Mouseover text: I laugh at the software as if I'm 100% confident that it's 2019.

Title: Terminator: Dark Fate
Mouseover text: I was sent here to stop the robot that was sent here to protect the human who was sent here to protect the human who was sent here to destroy the robot that was sent here to vacuum the floor.

Title: Screen Time
Mouseover text: These new Bluetooth socks are great, but it's troubling to learn that I average almost 14 hours of Shoe Time a day.

Title: Software Updates
Mouseover text: Everything is a cloud application; the ping times just vary a lot.

Mouseover text: The weirdest quirk of the Borda count is that Jean-Charles de Borda automatically gets one point; luckily this has no consequences except in cases of extremely low turnout.

Title: Recombination And Reionization
Mouseover text: These signals seem to be pre-star-formation but post-Malone.

Mouseover text: We're like 10+ movies in and the focus has been almost entirely on the WARS half.

Title: The Time Before and After Land

Title: Hotel Room Party
Mouseover text: [proudly greeting the hotel manager at the door] "Did I do a good job?"

Title: Aurora Meaning
Mouseover text: The astro-ph.SR arXiv servers are simultaneously being overwhelmed by electronic requests and actual electricity.

Title: How To Deliver Christmas Presents
Mouseover text: Building codes in hurricane zones rely on studies of how easily flying debris can break residential windows. If you're looking for a science fair project idea and you hate your neighbors, I'm sure they could always use more data!

Title: Group Chat Rules
Mouseover text: There's no group chat member more enigmatic than the cool person who you all assume has the chat on mute, but who then instantly chimes in with no delay the moment something relevant to them is mentioned.

Title: Is it Christmas?
Mouseover text: We've tested it on 30 different days and it hasn't gotten one wrong yet.

Title: AI Hiring Algorithm
Mouseover text: So glad Kate over in R&D pushed for using the AlgoMaxAnalyzer to look into this. Hiring her was a great decisio- waaaait.

Title: Flu Shot
Mouseover text: "Wait, how often are you getting bitten by snakes? And why are you boiling water?" "Dunno, the CDC people keep showing up with complicated questions about the 'history of the property' and 'possible curses' but I kinda tune them out. At least one of them offered me the flu shot."

Title: Data Error
Mouseover text: Cyanobacteria wiped out nearly all life on Earth once before, and they can do it again!

Title: Timeline of the Universe

Mouseover text: I love Brussels Sprouts Mandela Effect; I saw them open for Correct Horse Battery Staple.

Mouseover text: Water is thinner than both, and fire is *definitely* thicker.

Mouseover text: A tattoo of a tattoo parlor receipt

Title: Edible Arrangements
Mouseover text: Any arrangement is an edible arrangement if you're hungry enough.

Title: Weird Hill
Mouseover text: I'm compromising by picking a weird hill to lie on.

Mouseover text: "Off-by-one errors" isn't the easiest theme to build a party around, but I've seen worse.

Title: I Love the 20s
Mouseover text: Billboard's "Best of the 80s" chart includes Blondie's 1980 hit "Call Me." QED.

Title: OK/okay/ok
Mouseover text: After changing it back and forth several times and consulting with internet linguist Gretchen McCulloch, I settled on "ok" in my book How To, but I'm still on the fence. Maybe I should just switch to "oK."

Title: Alignment Chart Alignment Chart
Mouseover text: I would describe my personal alignment as "lawful heterozygous silty liquid."

Title: Parenthetical Names
Mouseover text: I never got around to seeing that movie about the battle (of Midway).

Mouseover text: There's some flexibility depending on your standards for measuring runtime and the various special editions. If you still want to have a party, I'm sure you can find some combination that works.

Title: JPEG2000
Mouseover text: I was actually a little relieved when I learned that JPEG2000 was used in the DCI digital cinema standard. I was feeling so bad for it!

Title: Tattoo Ideas
Mouseover text: The text ALL YOUR BASE ARE BELONG TO US with a lengthy footnote explaining that I got this tattoo in 2020 and not, as you may assume, 2001, but offering no further clarification.

Mouseover text: The projection does a good job preserving both distance and azimuth, at the cost of really exaggerating how many South Americas there are.

Mouseover text: "Actually, Jupiter already has a very impressive ring system!" --someone who knows Jupiter is within earshot

Title: Worst Thing That Could Happen
Mouseover text: Before I install any patch, I always open the patch notes and Ctrl-F for 'supervolcano', 'seagull', and 'garbage disposal', just to be safe.

Title: Parker Solar Probe
Mouseover text: It will get within 9 or 10 Sun-diameters of the "bottom" (the Sun's surface) which seems pretty far when you put it that way, but from up here on Earth it's practically all the way down.

Title: Cicadas
Mouseover text: After a while you adjust to the new cicadian rhythm.

Title: Satellite
Mouseover text: If you're going to let it burn up, make sure it happens over the deep end of the bathtub and not any populated parts of the house!

Title: Tax AI
Mouseover text: I ended up getting my tax return prepared at a local place by a really friendly pretrained neural net named Greg.

Title: Leap Smearing
Mouseover text: Some people suspect that it started as a "No, I didn't forget Valentine's Day" excuse that got out of hand.

Title: Blockchain
Mouseover text: Blockchains are like grappling hooks, in that it's extremely cool when you encounter a problem for which they're the right solution, but it happens way too rarely in real life.

Title: Further Research is Needed
Mouseover text: Further research is needed to fully understand how we managed to do such a good job.

Title: Phylogenetic Tree
Mouseover text: And I was kicked out of my March Madness pool because I wouldn't shut up about the evidence for NBA/ABA endosymbiosis.

Title: Picking Bad Stocks
Mouseover text: On the news a few days later: "Buzz is building around the so-called 'camping Roomba' after a big investment. Preorders have spiked, and..."

Title: Grandpa Jason and Grandpa Chad
Mouseover text: The AARP puts the average age of a first-time grandparent close to 50, and the CDC has some data. But I don't have first-parent age distributions for specific names, or generational first-child age correlations, so the dotted line is just a guess. Still, let's be honest: No further research is really *needed.*

Title: Ringtone Timeline
Mouseover text: No one likes my novelty ringtone, an audio recording of a phone on vibrate sitting on a hard surface.

Title: Truck Proximity
Mouseover text: See also: Farm animals and dinosaurs. I am so confident that there exists children's media that involves dinosaurs driving trucks on a farm that I'm writing this without even Googling to check.

Title: Stargazing 3
Mouseover text: If we can destroy enough of the lights in our region, we may see more comets, but that's a risk we'll have to take.

Title: Coronavirus Name
Mouseover text: It's important to keep the spider from touching your face.

Title: Self-Isolate
Mouseover text: Turns out I've been "practicing social distancing" for years without even realizing it was a thing!

Mouseover text: We have email and social media now, so we probably don't need to keep exchanging business cards by pressing them gently against each others' faces with an open palm and smearing them around.

Title: Scientific Briefing
Mouseover text: "I actually came in in the middle so I don't know which topic we're briefing on; the same slides work for like half of them."

Title: Symptoms
Mouseover text: This medicine says it may cause lightheadedness, dry mouth, and blurred vision, but my head feels incredibly heavy, water is pouring from my mouth, and I can see individual hummingbird wingbeats, so I think I'm fine.

Title: 2010 and 2020

Mouseover text: "Also, reading 500 coronavirus papers in a row and not sleeping? Probably not great for you either, but I haven't found any studies confirming that yet. I'll keep looking."

Mouseover text: Offscreen, bottom left: Whether the custom :coronavirus: Slack react emoji you just added was public domain or whether you should have put a Creative Commons credit somewhere

Mouseover text: Technically now it's a 34-foot zone.

Mouseover text: Spellcheck has been great, but whoever figures out how to get grammar check to work is guaranteed a Nobel.

Title: Coronavirus Polling
Mouseover text: If you want to see the polling questions we agree on MOST, you can check out Chapter 24 of my book How To, where I got the Roper Center on Public Opinion Research to help me design the world's least electable political campaign platform.

Title: Common Cold

Mouseover text: Later I'm going to get a head start on the heat bath.

Title: ISO Paper Size Golden Spiral
Mouseover text: The ISO 216 standard ratio is cos(45°), but American letter paper is 8.5x11 because it uses radians, and 8.5/11 = pi/4.

Mouseover text: You've got questions, we've got assumptions.

Title: Old Days 2

Title: Endorheic Basin

Title: Five Word Jargon

Title: Oily House Index

Mouseover text: Good thing I'm not already prone to overthinking everyday decisions!

Mouseover text: The Wirecutter staff called the Herman Miller Siege Perilous "the most cursed product we've ever had to fight" and "nearly as immortal as it boasts."

Title: Gravity

Title: Data Point

Title: Cold Complaints

Title: Etymonline

Title: Outdated Periodic Table
Mouseover text: Researchers claim to have synthesized six additional elements in the second row, temporarily named 'pentium' through 'unnilium'.

Title: Washing Machine Settings

Mouseover text: Who can forget the early 2010s memes? 'You know you're a 90s kid if you remember the feeling of warm sunlight on your face.' 'Only 90s kids remember the dawn.'

Title: K-Means Clustering
Mouseover text: According to my especially unsupervised K-means clustering algorithm, there are currently about 8 billion types of people in the world.

Title: Bursa of Fabricius
Mouseover text: If an anatomical structure is named for a person, it means they were the only person to have it. Pierre Paul Broca had a special area of his brain that created powerful magnetic fields, enabling him to do 19th century fMRI research.

Title: Size Comparisons

Title: Electron Color

Title: Coordinate Plane Closure

Title: Only Serifs
Mouseover text: If you ever want to get beaten up by a bunch of graphic designers, try removing the serifs from Times New Roman and adding them to Comic Sans.

Title: Weather Station
Mouseover text: 'Pour one out for precipitation data integrity,' I say, solemnly upending the glass into the rain gauge.

Title: Omniknot
Mouseover text: The Gordian knot is an omniknot tied using every bend in the Ashley Book of Knots, and then for extra security the upper rope at every crossing is connected to the lower with a randomly-chosen hitch.

Title: Data Quality
Mouseover text: [exclamation about how cute your cat is] -> [last 4 digits of your cat's chip ID] -> [your cat's full chip ID] -> [a drawing of your cat] -> [photo of your cat] -> [clone of your cat] -> [your actual cat] -> [my better cat]

Title: Square Packing
Mouseover text: I also managed to improve the solution for n=1 to s<0.97, and with some upgrades I think I can hit 0.96.

Title: Wish Interpretation
Mouseover text: "I wish for everything in the world. All the people, money, trees, etc." "Are you SURE you--" "And I want you to put it in my house."

Title: Island Storage
Mouseover text: I always hate dragging around the larger archipelagos, but I appreciate how the Scandinavian peninsula flexes outward to create a snug pocket for Britain and Ireland.

Title: Hand Dryers
Mouseover text: I know hand dryers have their problems, but I think for fun we should keep egging Dyson on and see if we can get them to make one where the airflow breaks the speed of sound.

Title: Fanservice

Title: Presents for Biologists

Title: Radians are Cursed
Mouseover text: Phil Plait once pointed out that you can calculate the total angular area of the sky this way. If the sky is a sphere with radius 57.3 degrees, then its area is 4*pi*r^2=41,253 square degrees. This makes dimensional analysts SO mad, but you can't argue with results.

Title: Lymphocytes
Mouseover text: It's very hard to detect, but recent studies have determined that when plasma B cells are producing antibodies, they go 'pew pew pew'

Title: Salt Dome

Title: Relative Terms

Title: Haunted House

Mouseover text: The debate over the correct Messier number for the Ship of Theseus is ongoing.

Title: Oceanography Gift

Title: Decay Modes

Title: Space Typography

Title: The Wrong Stuff

Title: Snow

Title: DateTime
